definition: to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing
concubine/I, your servant (deprecatory self-reference for women)

sentences.english: Concubinage is still the privilege of the rich class, but there still exist the phenomenon that the civilian concubinage.
sentences.chinese: 納妾雖屬於富貴階層的特權，但平民納妾也不在少數。

sentences.english: Concubinage is still the privilege of the rich class, but there still exist the phenomenon that the civilian concubinage.
sentences.chinese: 納妾雖屬於富貴階層的特權，但平民納妾也不在少數。

sentences.english: A variety of concubinage are parallel society in the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 各種納妾方式並行於唐代社會中。

sentences.english: Concubinage has a long history and was common through the early 20th century.
sentences.chinese: 男人納妾的歷史悠久，在19世紀早期也非常普遍。

sentences.english: Concubinage has made a come back in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 而最近這些年，納妾之風似乎有回潮的趨勢。

sentences.english: As a rule concubinage was more the custom than multiple wives.
sentences.chinese: 而納妾與一夫多妻制相比更符合中國的傳統風俗。

definition: open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
